reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, easy to install, not bulky
reviews.reviewText: So this is my third bed rail and I am finally satisfied. It was easy to install, it is sturdy and does the job well. I like that you can put the rail down when not in use.I have a queen size bed and it is perfect for intended use. Now my 17 year old min pin won’t be falling off the bed in the middle of the night.Great buy! Get it! You won’t be disappointed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well and adapted for metal bed frame
reviews.reviewText: This product is slightly on the expensive side but we like that it is the perfect length for a twin bed. Another reason we chose this product is because it can be easily folded down, allowing me to climb on the bed with him for his bedtime story. The installation was simple, though the instructions seemed to show an extra part... possibly for an extra long version? Anyways, it was easy to figure out.We installed this on a metal frame bed. It was tricky getting it to stay in place, but we used command picture frame hangers (the velcro-like ones) and it worked like a charm! I think it would work best on a wooden slate bed that can be drilled into, but our hack has worked so far without any problems. There is a rope structure that you can strap to the other side of the bed and that alone would not be enough to keep the product in place. Our bed is a twin so we had a lot of leftover rope but this means this product can also be used on a queen bed.Overall, this product does what it’s supposed to and folds down easily. The metal bars are padded and feel strong. I’m not sure what would happen if my son directly fell on top of it, but I don’t think there would be a problem. The only downside is that the folded down part is raised from the actual mattress bottom so making the bed can get a little tricky since you have to tuck it into the side but it’s a minor problem. I would rather have a hard time making the bed than to risk having this fall off the side and my child injuring himself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It is very high but very effective l.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Love this thing!..but only bc I sleep with my toddler sometimes and it keeps my big azz in the bed when she’s a very active sleeper lol.It’s very high! I didn’t realize how high, until I attached it to the twin bed. The length is perfect. The height is a dramatic. Especially if you have a narrow mattress (mine is 8”).Parts are thick. Width of the section fitting into the side of the bed frame is quite thick so changing the sheets is very cumbersome. I have to struggle to set the mattress free from being trapped in the railing.It’s sturdy. Once up, stays up even while toddler pulls and leans all her weight on it.Setting back down is tough since you have to press the buttons on each end of this very wide guard. So be prepared for that.Still happy with it. It’s pleasant to the eye, stays in place (all suggested attachment steps were followed).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid design and good size
reviews.reviewText: I bought one and liked it so much, I bought a second one. I really like how it folds down when not in use and it is easy to install and operate. I have a really thick mattress, but the gate reaches high enough to do it’s job. Despite the mattress being really heavy, the gate does slide out too easily when pushed directly. It does come with hardware to fasten it to the box spring however.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice for camper bunk
reviews.reviewText: We were looking for something to put in our top camper bunk for our 3 year old as our 1 year old needed to be in the bottom bunk (in a pack in play). This rail worked perfectly. I was able to screw it to the bunk frame to keep it secure. The fold down feature allowed us to put our 3 year old in the bunk for bed and close it so there wasn't a chance of falling out. Our child likes to move around a lot in bed. If the measurements fit your bunk opening, don't hesitate this purchase!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality, well built product; Good company
reviews.reviewText: First - I own two of these products. A 43 inch and 51 inch bed rail. If installed properly, this product is very sturdy and easy to use. My kids are safe and no problems at all.Second, in ordering another product of the same size, I was shipped a 59 inch product that someone put a 43 inch sticker on. This happened twice. I called Amazon and Amazon said they’d put the product on hold. But I contacted the seller and this was the best method. The seller offered me $20 for the inconvenience, which was in addition to Amazon fully refunding my purchase. So I recommend the product and recommend the company as well. I would definitely buy from this company again, which I did. I ordered a 51 inch bed rail and everything was good. Thanks

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really love this item and works well with my full bed for my toddle

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Doesn’t fit my crib with 54 inch
reviews.reviewText: I have a kalani crib with 54 inches in length. The rail is difficult to fit the crib and it is not possible to lower the rail as there is no space to push the side buttons. I fixed it to the queen bed next to crib in reverse fashion. If the hack doesn’t work as expected I may return the item.
Best baby product to invest in. Gives me tension free nights with my 2 kids under 2.
